option.value: {"/Users/devanshgoswami/Freelance/trainzilla/trainzilla-client":"{\"/app/+not-found.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a React Native screen component called `NotFoundScreen` that displays a message when a user navigates to a non-existent screen in the application. The screen includes a title, a message, and a link to the home screen. The file also defines some styles for the screen using the `StyleSheet` API.\",\"/package.json\":\"This file appears to be a package.json file for an Expo-based React Native project called \\\"trainzilla-client\\\". It lists the dependencies and devDependencies required for the project, as well as the available scripts for running the application. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, this file serves as a configuration and dependency management file for the project.\",\"/components/ui/TabBarBackground.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it exports an `undefined` value and a `useBottomTabOverflow` function.\\n\\nThe file appears to be a shim (a compatibility layer) for web and Android platforms where the tab bar is generally opaque. The `useBottomTabOverflow` function likely returns a value related to the height of the tab bar, which may be needed for layout or positioning purposes.\",\"/components/ParallaxScrollView.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`ParallaxScrollView`: A React component that renders a scrollable view with a parallax header image and a themed content area.\\n\\n`useBottomTabOverflow`: A custom hook that returns the bottom tab overflow value, which is used to adjust the content padding.\\n\\n`useColorScheme`: A custom hook that returns the current color scheme (light or dark).\\n\\n`useScrollViewOffset`: A custom hook that returns the current scroll offset of the Animated.ScrollView component.\\n\\n`useAnimatedStyle`: A custom hook that creates an animated style based on the scroll offset.\\n\\nThis file provides a reusable ParallaxScrollView component that can be used in a React Native application to display a scrollable view with a parallax header image and themed content area.\",\"/components/ThemedText.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`useThemeColor`: A custom hook that returns a color based on the current theme (light or dark).\\n\\n`ThemedText`: A React Native component that renders text with a color that can be customized based on the current theme and a predefined set of styles.\\n\\nThe file also defines a type `ThemedTextProps` that extends the `TextProps` type from React Native and adds additional properties for customizing the text color and style.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides a reusable text component that can be used throughout an application with consistent styling and theme-based color customization.\",\"/components/ui/IconSymbol.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`IconMapping`: A type that maps SF Symbols to their corresponding Material Icons names.\\n\\n`IconSymbolName`: A type that represents the keys of the `MAPPING` object.\\n\\n`MAPPING`: An object that maps specific SF Symbols to their corresponding Material Icons names.\\n\\n`IconSymbol`: A React component that renders a Material Icons icon based on the provided SF Symbol name, size, color, and style.\\n\\nThis file provides a fallback solution for using Material Icons on Android and web platforms when working with Expo, ensuring a consistent look and optimal resource usage across different platforms.\",\"/components/HelloWave.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`useEffect`: This function is used to set up the animation for the \\\"HelloWave\\\" component.\\n\\n`useAnimatedStyle`: This function is used to create an animated style for the \\\"HelloWave\\\" component based on the rotation animation.\\n\\n`HelloWave`: This function is a React component that displays a waving hand emoji with a rotating animation.\\n\\nThe file uses the `react-native-reanimated` library to create the animation for the \\\"HelloWave\\\" component, which is then rendered using the `ThemedText` component.\",\"/hooks/useColorScheme.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It simply exports the `useColorScheme` function from the `react-native` library. The `useColorScheme` function is used to detect the current color scheme (light or dark) of the user\\u0027s device and can be used to adjust the appearance of the application accordingly.\",\"/lib/auth.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`tokenKeys`: An object that defines the keys used to store access and refresh tokens in the Expo Secure Store.\\n\\n`saveTokens`: A function that saves the provided access and refresh tokens to the Expo Secure Store using the keys defined in `tokenKeys`.\\n\\n`clearTokens`: A function that removes the access and refresh tokens from the Expo Secure Store.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for managing the storage and retrieval of access and refresh tokens in the Expo Secure Store, which is a secure storage solution provided by the Expo framework.\",\"/app/(tabs)/index.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`HomeScreen`: This function renders a ParallaxScrollView component with a header image, a welcome message, and three steps for the user to follow.\\n\\nThe file appears to be a React Native screen component that provides a starting point for a new Expo project, with instructions and a React logo image. It uses several custom components, such as `HelloWave`, `ParallaxScrollView`, `ThemedText`, and `ThemedView`, to create a visually appealing and informative user interface.\",\"/components/ExternalLink.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`ExternalLink`: This function is a custom React component that renders a link that opens in an external browser on native platforms and a new tab on the web.\\n\\nThe file provides a reusable component for handling external links in an Expo-based application, ensuring that the links open in the appropriate browser environment based on the platform.\",\"/graphql/queries.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a GraphQL query using the `gql` function from the `@apollo/client` library. The query is named `GET_ME` and it retrieves the following information about the currently authenticated user:\\n\\n- `_id`: the unique identifier of the user\\n- `name`: the name of the user\\n- `email`: the email address of the user\\n- `avatarUrl`: the URL of the user\\u0027s avatar image\\n- `isProfileCompleted`: a boolean indicating whether the user\\u0027s profile is complete\\n\\nThis query can be used in a GraphQL-based application to fetch the current user\\u0027s information.\",\"/tsconfig.json\":\"This file appears to be a TypeScript configuration file for an Expo project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the project\\u0027s TypeScript configuration.\\n\\nThe key points of this configuration are:\\n\\n1. It extends the base TypeScript configuration provided by Expo.\\n2. It sets the `strict` compiler option to `true`, which enables stricter type checking.\\n3. It defines a `paths` configuration that allows the use of the `@/` prefix to reference files in the root directory of the project.\\n4. It includes all TypeScript and TSX files in the project, as well as the types for the Expo environment.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the TypeScript configuration for an Expo project, ensuring strict type checking and providing a convenient way to reference files in the project.\",\"/components/ui/TabBarBackground.ios.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`BlurTabBarBackground`: This function renders a BlurView component that covers the entire screen, providing a blurred background for the bottom tab bar.\\n\\n`useBottomTabOverflow`: This function is a custom hook that returns the height of the bottom tab bar, which can be used to adjust the layout of the content to avoid being obscured by the tab bar.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides a reusable component and a custom hook to create a blurred background for the bottom tab bar in a React Native application.\",\"/hooks/useColorScheme.web.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`useColorScheme`: This function is a custom React hook that returns the current color scheme (light or dark) of the user\\u0027s device. It handles the case where the component is rendered on the server (during static rendering) by returning \\u0027light\\u0027 as the default color scheme until the component has hydrated on the client side.\",\"/app/(auth)/login.tsx\":\"This file is a React Native component that handles the Google authentication flow for a mobile application called \\\"TrainZilla\\\". It uses the `expo-auth-session/providers/google` and `expo-web-browser` libraries to handle the Google OAuth2 authentication process.\\n\\n`Login`: This component renders a login screen with a Google sign-in button, and handles the Google authentication flow using the `useAuthRequest` hook from the `expo-auth-session/providers/google` library.\\n\\n`useEffect`: This function is used to handle the response from the Google authentication flow and perform the necessary actions, such as saving the access and refresh tokens using the `saveTokens` function, and navigating to the home screen using the `router.replace` function.\\n\\n`googleAuthSignIn`: This is a GraphQL mutation that is used to authenticate the user with the server using the Google ID token obtained during the authentication flow.\",\"/constants/Colors.ts\":\"This file defines a set of color variables for a React Native application, which can be used in both light and dark mode. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single object `Colors` that holds the color values for different UI elements in the app.\\n\\nThe file serves as a centralized location for managing the color scheme of the application, making it easier to maintain and update the visual appearance across the entire app.\",\"/hooks/useThemeColor.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`useThemeColor`: This function takes in a set of color properties for light and dark modes, and a color name, and returns the appropriate color based on the user\\u0027s current color scheme.\\n\\nThe file also imports the `Colors` constant from the `@/constants/Colors` module and the `useColorScheme` hook from the `@/hooks/useColorScheme` module. The purpose of this file is to provide a utility function for retrieving the appropriate color based on the user\\u0027s color scheme.\",\"/components/Chip.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`Chip`: This function renders a Pressable component that displays a chip-like UI element with a label, and can be selected or unselected based on the `selected` prop.\\n\\nThe file exports the `Chip` function, which can be used to create reusable chip UI elements in a React Native application.\",\"/components/ui/IconSymbol.ios.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`IconSymbol`: This function renders an icon symbol using the `SymbolView` component from the `expo-symbols` library, with customizable size, color, and weight.\\n\\nThe file appears to be a reusable React component that provides a simple way to display icons in a React Native application.\",\"/components/HapticTab.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`HapticTab`: This function is a custom React Navigation bottom tab bar button component that provides haptic feedback when the button is pressed on iOS devices.\",\"/app/(tabs)/explore.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`TabTwoScreen`: This function renders a ParallaxScrollView component with various collapsible sections that provide information and examples about the Expo framework, including file-based routing, platform support, images, custom fonts, light and dark mode, and animations.\\n\\n`styles`: This object defines the styles used in the `TabTwoScreen` component, including the styles for the header image and the title container.\\n\\nThis file is a React Native component that serves as a tutorial or example screen for an Expo-based application, showcasing various features and best practices of the Expo framework.\",\"/app/index.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is a React component that checks if the user is authenticated and redirects them to the appropriate page based on their authentication status.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Imports the necessary dependencies, including `useEffect` and `useState` from React, `Redirect` from `expo-router`, and `SecureStore` from `expo-secure-store`.\\n2. Defines a functional component called `Index` that checks the user\\u0027s authentication status and redirects them accordingly.\\n3. The `useEffect` hook is used to check the user\\u0027s authentication status by retrieving the `tz_access_token` from the Expo Secure Store.\\n4. The component renders a `Redirect` component that redirects the user to either the home page (`/(tabs)/home`) if they are authenticated, or the login page (`/(auth)/login`) if they are not.\",\"/components/TextField.tsx\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. The document appears to be an empty XML document with a `\\u003cdocument\\u003e` and `\\u003c/document\\u003e` tag, but no content within it.\",\"/graphql/types.ts\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. The document appears to be an empty XML document, which does not contain any meaningful content.\",\"/scripts/reset-project.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is a script that is used to reset a project to a blank state. The script deletes or moves the `/app`, `/components`, `/hooks`, `/scripts`, and `/constants` directories to a new `/app-example` directory based on user input. It then creates a new `/app` directory with an `index.tsx` and `_layout.tsx` file. The script is designed to help developers start a new project with a clean slate, while providing an option to save the existing files for reference.\",\"/app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a React component called `TabLayout` that renders a tab-based navigation interface using the `Tabs` component from the `expo-router` library. The component sets up the tab bar configuration, including the active tab color, header visibility, tab bar button, and tab bar background. It also defines two tab screens: \\\"Home\\\" and \\\"Explore\\\", each with a corresponding icon and title.\",\"/app.json\":\"This file is an Expo configuration file for a React Native application called \\\"trainzilla-client\\\". It defines various settings and configurations for the application, including the name, version, orientation, icons, and splash screen. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a JSON object with various properties that configure the Expo application.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this file is to provide a centralized location for configuring the various aspects of the Expo application, such as the name, icon, splash screen, and platform-specific settings for iOS and Android. This allows the application to be easily built and deployed across multiple platforms.\",\"/eslint.config.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it exports a configuration object for the ESLint linter, which is a tool used to enforce code style and quality standards in JavaScript projects.\\n\\nThe configuration object is defined using the `defineConfig` function from the `eslint/config` module, and it includes two parts:\\n\\n1. `expoConfig`: This is a pre-defined configuration for projects using the Expo framework, which is a popular development environment for building React Native applications.\\n2. `{ ignores: [\\u0027dist/*\\u0027] }`: This is an additional configuration that ignores the `dist` directory, which is likely used for the distribution or build artifacts of the project.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a centralized and customizable ESLint configuration for a project, making it easier to maintain code quality and consistency across the codebase.\",\"/lib/env.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it exports an object `ENV` that contains various environment variables used in the application. The environment variables include:\\n\\n`API_URL`: The URL for the application\\u0027s API.\\n`GOOGLE_ANDROID_CLIENT_ID`: The Google Android client ID for the application.\\n`GOOGLE_IOS_CLIENT_ID`: The Google iOS client ID for the application.\\n`GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID`: The Google web client ID for the application.\\n\\nThese environment variables are likely used throughout the application to interact with external services and APIs.\",\"/app/_layout.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up the Apollo client and provides it to the application using the `ApolloProvider` component from the `@apollo/client/react` library. The `Stack` component from the `expo-router` library is also used to configure the application\\u0027s navigation without showing the header. The purpose of this file is to set up the necessary infrastructure for the application to use the Apollo client for GraphQL data fetching and management.\",\"/app/(onboarding)/onboarding.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`toggle`: Toggles the selection of a dietary restriction or allowed food item in the form.\\n\\n`submit`: Handles the submission of the form, updating the user\\u0027s profile with the provided information.\\n\\n`Onboarding`: This is the main component that renders the onboarding screen, allowing the user to input their health conditions, dietary restrictions, allowed foods, and current weight.\\n\\nThe file implements a form using the `react-hook-form` library and the `zod` library for form validation. It also uses the `useMutation` hook from `@apollo/client/react` to update the user\\u0027s profile through a GraphQL mutation.\",\"/components/Collapsible.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`Collapsible`: A React component that renders a collapsible section with a title and content that can be toggled open or closed.\\n\\nThe file also imports several other components and hooks, including `ThemedText`, `ThemedView`, `IconSymbol`, `Colors`, and `useColorScheme`. The purpose of this file is to provide a reusable collapsible component that can be used in a React Native application.\",\"/components/ThemedView.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`useThemeColor`: A custom hook that returns the appropriate color based on the current theme (light or dark).\\n\\n`ThemedView`: A React Native component that renders a `View` with a background color that changes based on the current theme.\\n\\nThis file provides a reusable `ThemedView` component that allows you to easily create views with a background color that adapts to the user\\u0027s current theme (light or dark).\",\"/lib/apollo.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up an ApolloClient instance for a GraphQL API, with the following functionality:\\n\\n1. It creates an HTTP link to the GraphQL API endpoint using the `createHttpLink` function.\\n2. It sets up an authentication link using the `setContext` function, which retrieves an access token from the Expo Secure Store and includes it in the request headers.\\n3. It creates an ApolloClient instance by combining the authentication link and the HTTP link, and configures it to use an in-memory cache.\\n4. The ApolloClient instance can be exported and used throughout the application to make GraphQL queries and mutations.\",\"/package-lock.json\":\"This file appears to be a package.json file for a React Native project called \\\"trainzilla-client\\\". It lists the dependencies and devDependencies required for the project, including libraries for GraphQL, navigation, form handling, and more. There are no classes or functions defined in this file, as it is a configuration file rather than a source code file.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is a README file that provides an overview of an Expo project created with `create-expo-app`. The file includes instructions for getting started with the project, such as installing dependencies, starting the app, and resetting the project. It also provides links to the Expo documentation, a tutorial, and information about the Expo community.\",\"/components/Button.tsx\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. The document appears to be an empty XML document, which does not contain any meaningful content.\",\"/graphql/mutations.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it exports three GraphQL mutations:\\n\\n`GOOGLE_AUTH_SIGN_IN`: A mutation that signs in a user using Google authentication and returns the user\\u0027s access token and refresh token.\\n\\n`REFRESH_ACCESS_TOKEN`: A mutation that refreshes the user\\u0027s access token using the provided refresh token.\\n\\n`UPDATE_USER_PROFILE`: A mutation that updates the user\\u0027s profile information, including their name, email, dietary preferences, and weight history.\"}"}
